result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra L Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Conspiracy, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge by 7/18/18.  Nonpaymetn penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge. To be paid by 7/18/18.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work, treatment ad childcare.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassandra L Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from GAL dated 7/15/16, received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Court ordered letter submitted by the GAL to be sealed.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case recalled at 1:39 pm.  Sentencing hearing continued.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 120 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 8 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, treatment and child care.
- Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/18/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/18/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at $0.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Letters on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Arguments heard as to whether 2015 PSI should be considered by the Court during sentencing.  Court GRANTED defense motion to exclude the 2015 PSI from consideration.  Neither party has any corrections or objections to the 2016 PSI and the updated 2016 PSI.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Lariah D.  Correction made to PSI(s) by the Court.  Case adjourned to 1:30 pm this afternoon, 7/18/16.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Pretrial Report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The GAL was only available until 9:00 am this morning. The case was not called prior to 9:00 am, therefore the defense is withdrawing their request and leaving ir set for sentencing on 7/18/16.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail bond hearing. Defense counsel heard on motion to modify the no contact order. State objects. Court ordered case adjourned for continued bail bond hearing in Branch 15.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Cassandra L Jackson not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant's appearance is waived for todays bail review. Court amends bail to $500.00 cash with the previously ordered Turnover to Justice Point.
received and filed. sab
Court ordered the defendant TURNED OVER to Justice Point with drug testing, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substances and no firearms or dangerous weapons.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Jury in the box: 1:40 pm. Closing arguments continued. Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:00pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy J. Cross who was duly sworn for that purpose. Jury in the box: 2:31 pm. Exhibit #3 replayed for the panel. Jury out of the box: 2:49 pm.  At the hour of 4:40 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Court ordered a Presentence Report at the request of the defense WITHOUT RECOMMENDATION. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Jury in the box: 1:34 pm. Sworn for the Defense: Africka P. Sidebars held. Jury out of the box: 2:14 pm. Sidebars placed on the record. Jury in the box: 2:34 pm. Sworn for the Defense: Cassandra Jackson, defendant. Exhibits #8 - #10 received. Jury out of the box: 4:08 pm. Jury in the box: 4:16 pm. Defense rests. State rests. Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Jury out of the box: 4:55 pm. Trial recessed for the day.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense needs time to contact their potential witnesses. Jury in the box: 9:29 am. Court released the panel until 11:00 am. Jury out of the box: 9:32 am. Jury in the box: 11:20 am. Sworn for the Defense: Portia B., Felipa B. Jury out of the box: 11:52 am. Trial recessed for lunch.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./LNR 
Trial continues. Jury in the box at the hour of 1:18 pm. Questioning of Todd Armstrong, Investigator, Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office, continues. Sworn for the state:  Allison Schaper, Forensic Interviewer for Children's Hospital of Wisconsin. Exhibit 4, 5 and 6 received. Jury out of the box: 2:42 pm. Sidebar placed on the record. Jury in the box: 3:12 pm. Questioning of Allison Schaper continues. Side bars held. Sworn for the state: L.D. Sworn for the state: Lynn Gahagen, former Victim witness advocate for Milwaukee County. Sworn for the state: Meredith S. Side bar held. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box: 4:22 pm. Side bars placed on the record. Defense motion for dismissal at close of state's case denied by the court. Jury in the box: 4:44 pm. Court release Jury for the day. Court instructs Jury to return tomorrow, 5/25/16 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./LNR  
Case called. Discussions placed on the record prior to bringing the Jury in. Jury in the box at the hour of: 10:05 am. 
Jury sworn. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Todd Armstrong, Investigator, Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office. Sidebar held. Exhibits 1 and 2 received. Sidebar held. Jury out of box: 10:53 am. Sidebar discussions placed on the record. Jury in the box: 11:02 am. Exhibit 3 received. Sidebar held. Jury out of box: 11:09 am. Jury in the box: 11:17 am. Exhibit 7 received. Court releases jurors for lunch. Jury out of box: 11:54 pm. Court orders jurors back at 1:15 pm for continuation of proceedings. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to May 25, 2016 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./LNR  
Case recalled from this morning. Discussions prior to calling up the Jury Panel held on the record.   
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:47 pm.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 4:03 pm. Jury in the box at the hour of 4:28 pm. 
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause.  Jury list received and filed.  
Jury panel released for the day at the hour of 4:46 pm. Court orders Jurors back tomorrow, 5/24/16 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ LNR 
Matter is in court for Jury Trial. Defense counsel has an in-custody, Speedy Trial in another court. Matter is adjourned until 1:15 pm.
Court denied defense otion to modify no contact order.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Off the record conference held. Defense counsel was just appointed. Case calendared for STATUS on 8/25/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court is informed that the defendant wishes to withdraw her plea.  Statements are containted within the PSI and have been made today by the defendant.  Atty Carpenter is moving to withdraw as counsel of record.  The state has no objection to withdrawal of plea or of Atty Carpenter, but is requesting that the original NO CONTACT ORDER with LD(dob 3-3-2005) be reinstated which is ordered by the court.  The court will allow the defendant to withdraw her plea( Motion to be filed) and will allow Atty Carpenter to withdraw as counsel and orders that new counsel be appointed by SPD.
The case is adjourned for status of counsel and bail review.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  Case called.  Based upon information contained within the PSI report, defense counsel will confer with defendant has to whether she will be moving to withdraw her plea.  Case set for sentencing next week.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The PSI was just received by the court and counsels this morning.  Defense is not prepared to proceed to sentencing today and requests time to review PSI with defendant.  State has no objection.  Court will adjourn sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
PSI received and emailed to counsels at 7:20am
DOC supervisor Patty Beyer-Robinson contacted by court and agrees that PSI will be returned to court by 7/10/15. Parties notified.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Michael Thurston. Case calendared for a sentencing hearing. Deanna Weiss, GAL for the victim and baby sister (cases 14JC806 and 14JC807) appeared and made statements on behalf of the defense. Court orders a PSI, with recommendation for this case and orders the sentencing adjourned pending the return of the PSI. Parties are instructed that any information pertaining to sentencing is due to the court the week prior to the sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Court modifies no contact order to be consistent with Children's Court orders.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for Michael Thurston for the State of Wisconsin.
To the charge offense:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Defense is requesting, and without objection by the state, the court will modify no contact order to be consistent with Children's Court orders.
Case is adjourned to 6-23-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
GAL Deanna Weiss is also present in court.
Counsels continue to discuss possible resolution.  Court sets another final pretrial on 5-19-2015.
Filed by the state: Witness List; Motion in Limine; Notice of Expert Testimony; Notice of Intent to Use Child's Video Recorded Statement; Requested Jury Instructions
NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH LD(dob 3-3-2005)

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  Case called.  Defendant has cases pending in Children's Court 14JC806/807.  The court will modify the no contact order to NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH LD and will set a pretrial on 5-1-2015 at 8:15 at the request of defense counsel.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense was provided discovery today.    Case set for final pretrial on 4-23-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-8-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.

Defendant Cassandra L Jackson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Ron Dague for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-16-2015 at 08:30 am.
